harper.path.description: Optional path to a harper-ls executable to use.

harper.codeActions.ForceStable.description: Make code actions appear in "stable" positions by placing code actions that should always be available, like adding misspelled words in the dictionary, first.

harper.dialect.description: Set which dialect of English Harper should expect.

harper.diagnosticSeverity.description: How severe do you want diagnostics to appear in the editor?

harper.excludePatterns.description: A set of globs to ignore. If a file matches any of the globs, it will not be linted.

harper.fileDictPath.description: Optional path to a file dictionary directory to use.

harper.isolateEnglish.description: Only lint English text in documents that are a mixture of English and another language.

harper.maxFileLength.description: Maximum length of file to be linted (in bytes). If a file is larger than this, it will not be linted.

harper.userDictPath.description: Optional path to a user dictionary file to use.

harper.workspaceDictPath.description: Optional path to a workspace-local dictionary file to use.

harper.linters.ACoupleMore.description: Corrects `a couple of more` to `a couple more`.

harper.linters.AOkHyphen.description: Replaces the loose article-plus-abbreviation pairing with the standard hyphenated form whenever a linking verb describes readiness or approval.

harper.linters.APart.description: Finds and corrects common mistakes between 'a part' and 'apart'

harper.linters.AWhile.description: Enforces `awhile` after verbs and `a while` everywhere else.

harper.linters.Addicting.description: Replaces `addicting` with `addictive` when used as an adjective.

harper.linters.AdjectiveDoubleDegree.description: Finds adjectives that are used as double degrees (e.g. `more prettier`).

harper.linters.AdjectiveOfA.description: This rule looks for sequences of words of the form `adjective of a`.

harper.linters.AfterAWhile.description: Corrects the missing article in `after while`, forming `after a while`.

harper.linters.AfterLater.description: Checks for the word `later` following `after [a period of time]`.

harper.linters.Albeit.description: Corrects this expression to the standard `albeit`.

harper.linters.AllIntentsAndPurposes.description: Finds and corrects common wrong forms of the phrase 'for all intents and purposes' / 'to all intents and purposes'.

harper.linters.AllOfASudden.description: Guides this expression toward the standard `all of a sudden`.

harper.linters.AllReady.description: Flags `all ready` when it precedes an adjective so the adverb `already` can take its place.

harper.linters.AllThough.description: Nobody means to write the two-word phrase `all though` when the single word `although` is intended.

harper.linters.AllowTo.description: Flags erroneous usage of `allow to` without a subject.

harper.linters.Alongside.description: Replaces the spaced form `along side` with `alongside`.

harper.linters.AlzheimersDisease.description: Fixes the common misnomer `old-timers' disease`, ensuring the correct medical term `Alzheimer’s disease` is used.

harper.linters.AmInTheMorning.description: Finds redundant am/pm indicators used together with time periods such as 'in the morning' or 'at night'.

harper.linters.AmazonNames.description: When referring to the various products of Amazon.com, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Americas.description: When referring to North, Central, and South America, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.AmountsFor.description: Corrects `amounts for` to either `amounts to` or `accounts for`

harper.linters.AnA.description: A rule that looks for incorrect indefinite articles. For example, `this is an mule` would be flagged as incorrect.

harper.linters.AndIn.description: Fixes the incorrect phrase `an in` to `and in` for proper conjunction usage.

harper.linters.AndTheLike.description: Corrects mistakes in `and the like` and `or the like`.

harper.linters.AnotherThingComing.description: Though `another think coming` is the original phrase, `another thing coming` is now more common.

harper.linters.AnotherThinkComing.description: Though `another thing coming` is now more common, `another think coming` is the original phrase.

harper.linters.Anybody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `anybody`.

harper.linters.Anyhow.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `anyhow`.

harper.linters.Anywhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `anywhere`.

harper.linters.ApartFrom.description: Flags the misspelling `apart form` and suggests `apart from`.

harper.linters.AppleNames.description: When referring to Apple products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.ArriveOnWeekday.description: Keeps schedules explicit by preferring the familiar `arrive on Friday` pattern instead of a bare weekday.

harper.linters.AsFarBackAs.description: Corrects nonstandard `as early back as` to `as far back as`.

harper.linters.AsFollows.description: Corrects the phrase `as follow`, which is sometimes produced by overcorrection. While it appeared briefly in 19th-century English, it is now considered archaic; modern standard usage requires `as follows` regardless of number.

harper.linters.AsItHappens.description: Corrects `as it so happens` to `as it happens`.

harper.linters.AsOfCurrently.description: Corrects `as of currently` to `currently` or `as of now`.

harper.linters.AsOfLately.description: Corrects `as of lately` to `lately` or `as of late`.

harper.linters.AsOpposedTo.description: Corrects `as oppose to` to `as opposed to`.

harper.linters.AskNoPreposition.description: Identifies sequences like `ask to us` or `tell to him` and recommends removing the superfluous “to”.

harper.linters.AtFaceValue.description: Corrects `on face value` to the more usual `at face value`.

harper.linters.AtTheEndOfTheDay.description: Corrects `in the end of the day` to `at the end of the day`.

harper.linters.Australia.description: When referring to states, territories, and cities in Australia, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.AvoidAndAlso.description: Reduces redundancy by replacing `and also` with `and`.

harper.linters.AvoidCurses.description: Flags offensive language and offers various ways to censor or replace with euphemisms.

harper.linters.AwaitFor.description: Suggests using either `await` or `wait for` but not both, as they express the same meaning.

harper.linters.AzureNames.description: When referring to Azure cloud services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.BackInTheDay.description: This linter flags instances of the nonstandard phrase `back in the days`. The correct, more accepted form is `back in the day`

harper.linters.Backplane.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `backplane`.

harper.linters.BadRap.description: Changes `bed rap` to the proper idiom `bad rap`.

harper.linters.BanTogether.description: Detects and corrects the common error of using `ban together` instead of the idiom `band together`, which means to unite or join forces.

harper.linters.BareInMind.description: Ensures the phrase `bear in mind` is used correctly instead of `bare in mind`.

harper.linters.BatedBreath.description: Changes `baited breath` to the correct `bated breath`.

harper.linters.BeAllowed.description: Ensures the passive form uses `be allowed` after future negatives.

harper.linters.BeckAndCall.description: Fixes `back and call` to `beck and call`.

harper.linters.BeenThere.description: Corrects the misspelling `bee there` to the proper phrase `been there`.

harper.linters.Beforehand.description: `Beforehand` functions as a fixed adverb meaning ‘in advance’; writing it as two words or with a hyphen is nonstandard and can jar readers.

harper.linters.BehindTheScenes.description: Corrects `behind the scene` to `behind the scenes`.

harper.linters.BesideThePoint.description: Corrects `besides the point` to `beside the point`.

harper.linters.BestOfAllTime.description: Checks for nonstandard `of all times` in superlatives instead of singular `time`

harper.linters.BestRegards.description: In valedictions, `best` expresses your highest regard—avoid the typo `beat regards`.

harper.linters.BetterOffWith.description: Corrects `better of with` to `better off with`.

harper.linters.BewareOf.description: The verb `beware` naturally pairs with `of` before the noun being warned about, so swap other prepositions for clarity.

harper.linters.BlacklistWhitelist.description: Normalize the two-word sequence `black list`/`white list` so it matches the established compound noun or verb.

harper.linters.BlanketStatement.description: Corrects common errors in the phrase `blanket statement`.

harper.linters.BoringWords.description: This rule looks for particularly boring or overused words. Using varied language is an easy way to keep a reader's attention.

harper.linters.Bought.description: Replaces the incorrect past-tense spelling `bough` with `bought` after subject pronouns.

harper.linters.BrandBrandish.description: Looks for `brandish` wrongly used when `brand` is intended.

harper.linters.Brutality.description: Suggests the more standard and common synonym `brutality`.

harper.linters.BuiltIn.description: English convention treats `built-in` as a single, attributive adjective—meaning something integrated from the outset—whereas other forms like `in built` are nonstandard and can feel awkward to readers.

harper.linters.ByAccident.description: Incorrect preposition: `by accident` is the idiomatic expression.

harper.linters.CanBeSeen.description: Corrects `can be seem` to the proper phrase `can be seen`.

harper.linters.Canada.description: When referring to provinces, territories, and cities in Canada, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.CapitalizePersonalPronoun.description: Forgetting to capitalize personal pronouns, like "I" or "I'm" is one of the most common errors. This rule helps with that.

harper.linters.CaseInPoint.description: Corrects `case and point` to `case in point`.

harper.linters.CautionaryTale.description: Corrects confusion between `tale` (story) and `tail` (appendage) in common phrases.

harper.linters.ChampAtTheBit.description: Corrects `chomp at the bit` to the idiom `champ at the bit`, which has an equestrian origin referring to the way an anxious horse grinds its teeth against the metal part of the bridle.

harper.linters.ChangeTack.description: Locates errors in the idioms `to change tack` and `change of tack` to convey the correct meaning of altering one's course or strategy.

harper.linters.ChineseCommunistParty.description: When referring to the political party, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.ChockFull.description: Flags common soundalikes of "chock-full" and makes sure they're hyphenated.

harper.linters.ClickThroughRate.description: Hyphenates the verb+preposition pair when it directly precedes rate-style nouns, mirroring how these terms are commonly styled in analytics writing.

harper.linters.ClientOrServerSide.description: Corrects extraneous apostrophe in `client's side` and `server's side`.

harper.linters.CommaFixes.description: Fix common comma errors such as no space after, erroneous space before, etc., Asian commas instead of English commas, etc.

harper.linters.CompaniesProductsAndTrade.description: Ensure proper capitalization of companies, products, and trademarks.

harper.linters.CompoundNouns.description: Detects compound nouns split by a space and suggests merging them when both parts form a valid noun.

harper.linters.CompoundSubjectI.description: Promotes `I` in compound subjects headed by a possessive determiner.

harper.linters.ComprisesOf.description: `Comprises` already contains the notion of `of`, so following it with another `of` is redundant.

harper.linters.CondenseAllThe.description: Suggests removing `of` in `all of the` for a more concise phrase.

harper.linters.Confident.description: This linter detects instances where the noun `confidant` is incorrectly used in place of the adjective `confident`. `Confidant` refers to a trusted person, whereas `confident` describes certainty or self-assurance. The rule suggests replacing `confidant` with `confident` when used in an adjectival context.

harper.linters.Copyright.description: Corrects `copywrite` to `copyright`. `Copywrite` refers to writing copy, while `copyright` is the legal right to creative works.

harper.linters.CorrectNumberSuffix.description: When making quick edits, it is common for authors to change the value of a number without changing its suffix. This rule looks for these cases, for example: `2st`.

harper.linters.Countries.description: When referring to Countries, make sure to treat it as a proper noun.

harper.linters.CoursingThroughVeins.description: In English idioms, `to course` means to flow rapidly—so avoid the eggcorn `cursing through veins.`

harper.linters.CriteriaPhenomena.description: The words “criteria” and “phenomena” are the plurals of “criterion” and “phenomenon”, respectively. They are often incorrectly used as singular.

harper.linters.CureFor.description: Flags `cure against` and prefers the standard `cure for` pairing.

harper.linters.CurrencyPlacement.description: The location of currency symbols varies by country. The rule looks for and corrects improper positioning.

harper.linters.DampSquib.description: Corrects the eggcorn `damp squid` to `damp squib`, ensuring the intended meaning of a failed or underwhelming outcome.

harper.linters.Dashes.description: Writers often type `--` or `---` expecting their editor to convert them into proper dashes. Replace these sequences with the correct characters: use an en dash (–) for ranges or connections and an em dash (—) for a break in thought.

harper.linters.DayAndAge.description: Fixes wrong variants of the idiom `in this day and age`.

harper.linters.DayOneNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Day One and Day One Premium as brand names.

harper.linters.DefiniteArticle.description: The name of the word `the` is `definite article`.

harper.linters.Desktop.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `desktop`.

harper.linters.DespiteItIs.description: Corrects `despite` being used with the wrong form of `is`.

harper.linters.DespiteOf.description: Corrects the misuse of `despite of` and suggests the proper alternatives `despite` or `in spite of`.

harper.linters.Devops.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `devops`.

harper.linters.DidPast.description: Corrects past forms of verbs to their base form, when used together with "did".

harper.linters.DiscourseMarkers.description: Flags sentences that begin with a discourse marker but omit the required following comma.

harper.linters.DisjointPrefixes.description: Looks for words with their prefixes written with a space or hyphen between instead of joined.

harper.linters.DoIAdjective.description: Swaps the helping verb `do` for `am` in `Do I <adjective>` questions so they use the correct linking verb.

harper.linters.DoNotWant.description: In English, negation still requires the complete verb form (`want`), so avoid truncating it to `wan.`

harper.linters.DoToDueTo.description: Corrects the typo `do to` when it is intended to mean `due to` in causal phrases.

harper.linters.DoesOrDose.description: Tries to correct typos of `dose` to `does`.

harper.linters.DotInitialisms.description: Ensures common initialisms (like "i.e.") are properly dot-separated.

harper.linters.DoubleModal.description: Two modal verbs in a row are rarely grammatical; remove one of them.

harper.linters.DoubleNegative.description: Replaces the determiner `no` with `any` when it follows the auxiliary `didn't/did not` plus a main verb (e.g., have, need, want, make, take, get) so the clause contains only one negation.

harper.linters.DuringAges.description: The idiomatic duration is 'for ages', so swap the initial preposition whenever the words refer to a general span.

harper.linters.EachAndEveryOne.description: Corrects `each and everyone` to `each and every one`.

harper.linters.EagleEyed.description: Treats the phrase as a compound modifier and replaces the space with a hyphen so it reads like one idea.

harper.linters.EggYolk.description: Corrects the eggcorn `egg yoke`, replacing it with the standard culinary term `egg yolk`.

harper.linters.EllipsisLength.description: Make sure you have the correct number of dots in your ellipsis.

harper.linters.ElsePossessive.description: Detects missing apostrophes in phrases like `someone elses book` and suggests the correct possessive form `else’s`.

harper.linters.EludedTo.description: Corrects `eluded to` to `alluded to` in contexts referring to indirect references.

harper.linters.EnMasse.description: Detects variants like `on mass` or `in mass` and suggests `en masse`.

harper.linters.EnRoute.description: Detects variants like `on route` or `in route` and suggests `en route`.

harper.linters.EverEvery.description: Tries to correct typos of `every` instead of `ever`.

harper.linters.EverPresent.description: Corrects the missing hyphen in `ever present` to the compound adjective `ever-present`.

harper.linters.EveryOnceAndAgain.description: Corrects `every once and again` to `every once in a while` or `once again`.

harper.linters.Everybody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `everybody`.

harper.linters.Everyday.description: This rule tries to sort out confusing the adjective `everyday` and the adverb `every day`.

harper.linters.Everyone.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `everyone`.

harper.linters.Everywhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `everywhere`.

harper.linters.Excellent.description: Provides a stronger word choice by replacing `very good` with `excellent` for clarity and emphasis.

harper.linters.ExpandAlloc.description: Expands the abbreviation `alloc` to the full word `allocate` or `allocation` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandArgument.description: Expands the abbreviation `arg` to the full word `argument` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandBecause.description: Expands the informal abbreviation `cuz` to the full word `because` for formality.

harper.linters.ExpandControl.description: Expands the informal abbreviation `ctrl` to the full word `control` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandDecl.description: Expands the abbreviation `decl` to the full word `declaration` or `declarator` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandDependencies.description: Expands the abbreviation `deps` to the full word `dependencies` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandDeref.description: Expands the abbreviation `deref` to the full word `dereference` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandForward.description: Expands the abbreviation `fwd` to the full word `forward` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandMemoryShorthands.description: Expands memory-related abbreviations (`B`, `kB`, `MB`, `GB`, `TB`, `PB`, `KiB`, `MiB`, `GiB`, `TiB`, `PiB`, etc.) to their full forms (`byte`, `kilobyte`, `megabyte`, `gigabyte`, `terabyte`, `petabyte`, `kibibyte`, `mebibyte`, `gibibyte`, `tebibyte`, `pebibyte`, etc.).

harper.linters.ExpandMinimum.description: Expands the abbreviation `min` to the full word `minimum` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandParameter.description: Expands the abbreviation `param` to the full word `parameter` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandPointer.description: Expands the abbreviation `ptr` to the full word `pointer` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandPrevious.description: Expands the abbreviation `prev` to the full word `previous` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandStandardInputAndOut.description: Expands the abbreviations `stdin`, `stdout`, and `stderr` to the full words `standard input`, etc. for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandThrough.description: Expands the informal spelling `thru` to the standard word `through`.

harper.linters.ExpandTimeShorthands.description: Expands time-related abbreviations (`hr`, `hrs`, `min`, `mins`, `sec`, `secs`, `ms`, `msec`, `msecs`) to their full forms (`hour`, `hours`, `minute`, `minutes`, `second`, `seconds`, `millisecond`, `milliseconds`).

harper.linters.ExpandWith.description: Expands the abbreviation `w/` to the full word `with` for clarity.

harper.linters.ExpandWithout.description: Expands the abbreviation `w/o` to the full word `without` for clarity.

harper.linters.Expat.description: Corrects the mistake of writing `expat` as two words.

harper.linters.Expatriate.description: Fixes the misinterpretation of `expatriate`, ensuring the correct term is used for individuals residing abroad.

harper.linters.ExplanationMark.description: Corrects the eggcorn `explanation mark/point` to `exclamation mark/point`.

harper.linters.ExtendOrExtent.description: Corrects `extend` to `extent` when the context is a noun.

harper.linters.FaceFirst.description: Ensures `face first` is correctly hyphenated as `face-first` when used before `into`.

harper.linters.FarAndFewBetween.description: Corrects `far and few between` to the standard idiom `few and far between`.

harper.linters.FarBeIt.description: Flags misuse of `far be it` and suggests using `from` when it is followed by `for`

harper.linters.FascinatedBy.description: Ensures the correct prepositions are used with `fascinated` (e.g., `fascinated by` or `fascinated with`).

harper.linters.FastPaste.description: Detects incorrect usage of `fast paste` or `fast-paste` and suggests `fast-paced` as the correct phrase.

harper.linters.FatalOutcome.description: Replaces `fatal outcome` with the more direct term `death` for conciseness.

harper.linters.FeelFell.description: Corrects some expressions using `fell` where `feel` is correct.

harper.linters.FetalPosition.description: Ensures the correct use of `fetal position`, avoiding confusion with `feeble position`, which is not a standard phrase.

harper.linters.FewUnitsOfTimeAgo.description: Corrects some expressions using `few` where `a few` is correct.

harper.linters.FindFine.description: Fixes the common typo where writers write `find` when they mean `fine`.

harper.linters.FirstAidKit.description: Detects when “kid” after “aid”, “starter”, “travel”, or “tool” should be “kit” (a set of supplies).

harper.linters.FleshOutVsFullFledged.description: Corrects mixing up `flesh out` and `full fledged`.

harper.linters.FoamAtTheMouth.description: Corrects the idiom `foam out the mouth` to the standard `foam at the mouth`.

harper.linters.FootTheBill.description: Corrects `flip the bill` to `foot the bill`.

harper.linters.ForALongTime.description: Eliminates the incorrect merging in `for along time`.

harper.linters.ForAWhile.description: Corrects the missing article in `for while`, forming `for a while`.

harper.linters.ForNoun.description: Corrects the archaic or mistaken `fro` to `for` when followed by a noun.

harper.linters.FreePredicate.description: Helps swap in `free` when a linking verb is followed by the noun `fee`.

harper.linters.FreeRein.description: Ensures the correct use of `free rein`, avoiding confusion with `free reign`, which incorrectly suggests authority rather than freedom of action.

harper.linters.Freezing.description: Encourages vivid writing by suggesting `freezing` instead of weaker expressions like `very cold.`

harper.linters.FriendOfMe.description: Corrects wrong pronoun usage in constructions like `a friend of me`.

harper.linters.FromTheGetGo.description: Ensures `from the get-go` is correctly hyphenated, preserving the idiom’s meaning of ‘from the very beginning’.

harper.linters.Furthermore.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `furthermore`.

harper.linters.GetRidOf.description: Corrects common misspellings of the idiom `get rid of`.

harper.linters.GildedAge.description: If referring to the period of economic prosperity, the correct term is `Gilded Age`.

harper.linters.GoSoFarAsTo.description: Flags 'go so far to' when it should be 'go so far as to' to express going beyond expectations

harper.linters.GoToWar.description: Replaces `go at war` with `go to war`.

harper.linters.GoggleBrand.description: Replaces the misspelling `goggle` when it is paired with a well-known Google service.

harper.linters.GoingTo.description: Corrects `gong to` to the intended phrase `going to`.

harper.linters.GoodAt.description: Checks for `good in` used instead of `good at` to describe proficiency with a skill.

harper.linters.GoogleNames.description: When referring to Google products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.GuineaBissau.description: Checks for the correct official name of the African country.

harper.linters.HadOf.description: Flags the unnecessary use of `of` after `had` and suggests the correct forms.

harper.linters.HalfAnHour.description: Fixes the eggcorn `half an our` to the accepted `half an hour`.

harper.linters.Handful.description: Keeps the palm-sized quantity expressed by `handful` as one word.

harper.linters.Haphazard.description: Corrects the eggcorn `half hazard` to `haphazard`, which properly means lacking organization or being random.

harper.linters.HavePassed.description: Suggests `past` for `passed` in case a verb was intended.

harper.linters.HavePronoun.description: Flags questions that begin with `has` followed by a pronoun that requires `have`, such as `Has we …` or `Has I …`, and suggests the correct auxiliary.

harper.linters.HaveTakeALook.description: Corrects either `have a look` or `take a look` to the other, depending on the dialect.

harper.linters.HeartToHeard.description: Corrects `heart` or `herd` to `heard` in common `have ... heard of/about` questions.

harper.linters.Hedging.description: Flags hedging language (e.g. `I would argue that`, `..., so to speak`, `to a certain degree`).

harper.linters.HelloGreeting.description: Encourages greeting someone with `hello` instead of the homophone `halo`.

harper.linters.Henceforth.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `henceforth`.

harper.linters.Hereby.description: `Here by` in some contexts should be `hereby`

harper.linters.Holidays.description: When referring to holidays, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.HomeInOn.description: Corrects `hone in on` to `home in on`.

harper.linters.HopHope.description: Handles common errors involving `hop` and `hope`. Ensures `hop` is used correctly in phrases like `hop on a bus` while correcting mistaken uses of `hope` in contexts where `hop` is expected.

harper.linters.HowItLooksLike.description: Corrects `how ... looks like` to `how ... looks` or `what ... looks like`.

harper.linters.HowMach.description: Swaps `how mach` or `how match` with the correct quantifier `how much`.

harper.linters.HowTo.description: Detects the omission of `to` in constructions like `how clone / how install` and suggests `how to …`.

harper.linters.However.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `however`.

harper.linters.HumanBeings.description: Eliminates the incorrect possessive/plural usage like `human's beings` or `humans beings`.

harper.linters.HyphenateNumberDay.description: Ensures a hyphen is used in `X-day` when it is part of a compound adjective, such as `4-day work week`.

harper.linters.IAm.description: Fixes the incorrect spacing in `I a m` to properly form `I am`.

harper.linters.IfWouldve.description: Corrects `if I would've done` etc. to `if I had done` etc.

harper.linters.ImitateFrom.description: After `imitate ...`, idiomatic phrasing points to the inspiration with `of` instead of `from`.

harper.linters.InAWhile.description: Corrects the missing article in `in while`, forming `in a while`.

harper.linters.InAnyWay.description: Corrects ungrammatical `in anyway` to `in any way`.

harper.linters.InDetail.description: Corrects unidiomatic plural `in details` to `in detail`.

harper.linters.InLieuOf.description: Corrects the misspelling `in lue of` to `in lieu of`.

harper.linters.InNeedOf.description: Corrects `in need for` to `in need of`.

harper.linters.InOfItself.description: Corrects nonstandard `in of itself` to standard `in itself` or `in and of itself`.

harper.linters.InOnTheCards.description: Corrects either `in the cards` or `on the cards` to the other, depending on the dialect.

harper.linters.InOneFellSwoop.description: Corrects `in one foul swoop` to `in one fell swoop`, preserving the phrase’s original meaning of sudden and complete action.

harper.linters.InThe.description: Detects and corrects a spacing error where `in the` is mistakenly written as `int he`. Proper spacing is essential for readability and grammatical correctness in common phrases.

harper.linters.InflectedVerbAfterTo.description: This rule looks for `to verb` where `verb` is not in the infinitive form.

harper.linters.Insensitive.description: Suggests the more standard and common synonym `insensitive`.

harper.linters.Insofar.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `insofar`.

harper.linters.Instead.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `instead`.

harper.linters.InsteadOf.description: Corrects the archaic or mistaken separation `in stead of` to `instead of` in everyday usage.

harper.linters.Insurmountable.description: Suggests the more standard and common synonym `insurmountable`.

harper.linters.Intact.description: Prevents the erroneous spacing in `in tact`; `intact` is the single correct word.

harper.linters.InterestedIn.description: Ensures the correct preposition is used with the word `interested` (e.g. `interested in`).

harper.linters.IsKnownFor.description: Typo: `known` is the correct past participle.

harper.linters.ItCan.description: Corrects the misspelling `It cam` to the proper phrase `It can`.

harper.linters.ItLooksLikeThat.description: Corrects `it looks like that` to just `it looks like`.

harper.linters.ItsContraction.description: The possessive `its` is often mistaken for `it's` when it is followed by vague pronouns (any-, every-, some-, or no- + body/one/thing/where).

harper.linters.ItsPossessive.description: In English, possessive pronouns never take an apostrophe. Use `its` to show ownership (e.g. “its texture”) and avoid confusing it with `it's`, which always means “it is” or “it has.”

harper.linters.Itself.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `itself`.

harper.linters.IveGotTo.description: Corrects the slip `I've go to` to the idiomatic `I've got to`.

harper.linters.JawDropping.description: Corrects `jar-dropping` to `jaw-dropping`, ensuring the intended meaning of something that causes amazement.

harper.linters.JetpackNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Jetpack-related terms.

harper.linters.JustDeserts.description: Ensures `just deserts` is used correctly, preserving its meaning of receiving an appropriate outcome for one's actions.

harper.linters.KindSortOf.description: Flags `kind if` or `sort off` that stand before qualifiers so the filler `of` stays intact.

harper.linters.Koreas.description: When referring to the nations, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Laos.description: When referring to provinces and cities in Laos, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.Laptop.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `laptop`.

harper.linters.LastButNotLeast.description: Corrects common errors in the phrase `last but not least`.

harper.linters.LastDitch.description: Corrects wrong variations of the idiomatic adjective `last-ditch`.

harper.linters.LastNight.description: Flags `yesterday night` and suggests the standard phrasing `last night`.

harper.linters.LaughOfAt.description: Warns when `laugh` takes `of` before a person or pronoun and nudges writers toward the conventional `at`.

harper.linters.LayoutVerb.description: Flags nonstandard verb forms of `layout` (like `layouted` and `layouting`) and suggests the standard English verb forms (`laid out` and `laying out`).

harper.linters.LeadRiseTo.description: Corrects `leads rise to` to `gives rise to`.

harper.linters.LeaveToFor.description: When describing travel plans that include a destination and a time frame, prefer `leave for a destination` instead of `leave to a destination`.

harper.linters.LeftRightHand.description: Ensures `left hand` and `right hand` are hyphenated when used as adjectives before a noun, such as in `left-hand side` or `right-hand corner`.

harper.linters.LessWorse.description: Suggests alternatives to `less/least worse/worst` for more standard, clearer comparisons.

harper.linters.LetsConfusion.description: It's often hard to determine where the subject should go with the word `let`. This rule attempts to find common errors with redundancy and contractions that may lead to confusion for readers.

harper.linters.LikeAsIf.description: Corrects redundant `like as if` to `like` or `as if`.

harper.linters.LikeThePlague.description: Corrects `like a plague` to `like the plague`.

harper.linters.LikeTheresNoTomorrow.description: Corrects `like no tomorrow` to `like there's no tomorrow`.

harper.linters.LikelyHood.description: Treat the split tokens as one compound word (`likelihood`) whenever the adjective `likely` precedes `hood`.

harper.linters.Likewise.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `likewise`.

harper.linters.LinesOfCode.description: Corrects pluralizing the wrong noun in `lines of code`.

harper.linters.LitotesDirectPositive.description: Offers direct-positive alternatives when double negatives might feel heavy.

harper.linters.LongSentences.description: This rule looks for run-on sentences, which can make your work harder to grok.

harper.linters.LookDownOnesNose.description: Corrects `look one's nose down` to `look down one's nose`

harper.linters.LookingForwardTo.description: This rule identifies instances where the phrase `looking forward to` is followed by a base form verb instead of the required gerund (verb + `-ing` form).

harper.linters.LooksLikes.description: This rule turns `looks likes`, `looked likes`, and `looking likes` into the idiomatic `look ... like`.

harper.linters.MakeDoWith.description: Corrects `make due` to `make do` when followed by `with`.

harper.linters.MakeItSeem.description: Corrects `make it seems` to `make it seem`.

harper.linters.Malaysia.description: When referring to the states of Malaysia and their capitals, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.ManagerialReins.description: Corrects the eggcorn `managerial reigns` to the idiomatic `managerial reins`.

harper.linters.MassNouns.description: Detects mass nouns used as countable nouns.

harper.linters.MercedesBenzHyphen.description: Connect the separate words `Mercedes` and `Benz` whenever they appear together so the brand stays consistent with its official styling.

harper.linters.MergeWords.description: Accidentally inserting a space inside a word is common. This rule looks for valid words that are split by whitespace.

harper.linters.MetaNames.description: When referring to Meta products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.MicrosoftNames.description: When referring to Microsoft products and services, make sure to treat them as proper nouns.

harper.linters.Middleware.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `middleware`.

harper.linters.MissingDeterminer.description: Detects likely missing determiners in common request phrases and offers to insert one where necessary.

harper.linters.MissingTo.description: Flags verbs and adjectives like `need`, `want`, or `ready` that are missing `to` before an infinitive.

harper.linters.Misspell.description: Ensures `misspell` and its inflected forms are written as a single word.

harper.linters.Misunderstand.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misunderstand`.

harper.linters.Misunderstood.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misunderstood`.

harper.linters.Misuse.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misuse`.

harper.linters.Misused.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `misused`.

harper.linters.MixedBag.description: Corrects the eggcorn `mixed bad` to `mixed bag`.

harper.linters.ModalBeAdjective.description: Looks for `be` missing between a modal verb and adjective.

harper.linters.ModalSeem.description: Detects modal verbs followed by `seen` before adjectives and suggests `seem` or `be`.

harper.linters.Months.description: Detects months written with a lowercase first letter.

harper.linters.Monumentous.description: Advises using `momentous` or `monumental` instead of `monumentous` for serious usage.

harper.linters.MootPoint.description: Corrects `mute` to `moot` in the phrase `moot point`.

harper.linters.MoreAdjective.description: Looks for comparative adjective constructions with `more` than could use inflected forms.

harper.linters.MoreBetter.description: Finds redundant paring of `more` or `most` with adjectives already in the comparative or superlative form.

harper.linters.MostOfTheTimes.description: Corrects `a lot of the times` and `most of the times` to use singular `time`.

harper.linters.Multicore.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `multicore`.

harper.linters.Multimedia.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `multimedia`.

harper.linters.MultipleSequentialPronoun.description: When editing work to change point of view (i.e. first-person or third-person) it is common to add pronouns while neglecting to remove old ones. This rule catches cases where you have multiple disparate pronouns in sequence.

harper.linters.Multithreading.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `multithreading`.

harper.linters.MyHouse.description: Fixes the typo `mu house` to `my house`.

harper.linters.Myself.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `myself`.

harper.linters.NailOnTheHead.description: Replaces hat/had/hit/hid in the idiom `nail on the head` with `head`.

harper.linters.NationalCapitals.description: When referring to national capitals, make sure to treat it as a proper noun.

harper.linters.NeedHelp.description: Changes `ned help` to the correct `need help`.

harper.linters.NeedToNoun.description: Flags `need to` when it is immediately followed by a noun, which usually means the infinitive verb is missing.

harper.linters.NerveRacking.description: Corrects common misspellings and missing hyphen in `nerve-racking`.

harper.linters.NervousWreck.description: Suggests using `nervous wreck` when referring to a person's emotional state.

harper.linters.NoFrenchSpaces.description: Stops users from accidentally inserting French spaces.

harper.linters.NoLonger.description: Corrects `not longer` when it should be `no longer`.

harper.linters.NoOxfordComma.description: The Oxford comma is one of the more controversial rules in common use today. Enabling this lint checks that there is no comma before `and`, `or` or `nor` when listing out more than two ideas.

harper.linters.NobelPeacePrize.description: Corrects the frequent typos that swap the Nobel/Peace/Prize spelling when people mention the prize.

harper.linters.Nobody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nobody`.

harper.linters.NominalWants.description: Ensures you use the correct `want` / `wants` after a nominal.

harper.linters.Nonetheless.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nonetheless`.

harper.linters.NorModalPronoun.description: Corrects the order of the pronoun and modal verb after `nor`.

harper.linters.NotBeAfterNot.description: Removes the redundant linking verb that sneaks in between `not` and the predicate after a conjugated `be`.

harper.linters.NotOnly.description: Corrects `no only` to `not only` before forms of `to be`.

harper.linters.NotTo.description: Corrects `no to` to `not to`, ensuring proper negation.

harper.linters.NotablePlaces.description: Ensure proper capitalization of notable places that are significant regional centers, travel destinations, or have international importance.

harper.linters.Nothing.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nothing`.

harper.linters.Notwithstanding.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `notwithstanding`.

harper.linters.NounVerbConfusion.description: Handles common confusions between related nouns and verbs (e.g., 'advice/advise', 'breath/breathe')

harper.linters.Nowhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `nowhere`.

harper.linters.NumberSuffixCapitalizatio.description: You should never capitalize number suffixes.

harper.linters.ObsessPreposition.description: Ensures valid prepositions are used with `obsess`

harper.linters.OceansAndSeas.description: When referring to the world's oceans and seas, ensure they are treated as proper nouns.

harper.linters.OfCourse.description: Detects the common mistake `off course` and suggests the correct form `of course`.

harper.linters.OldWivesTale.description: Corrects `old wise tale` to `old wives' tale`, preserving the phrase’s meaning as an unfounded traditional belief.

harper.linters.OldestInTheBook.description: Detects the idiom `oldest X in the books`, which should use singular `book`.

harper.linters.OnFirstGlance.description: The standard idiom starts with `at` for quick appraisals, so swap the preposition to keep the phrase idiomatic.

harper.linters.OnFloor.description: This rule identifies incorrect uses of the prepositions `in` or `at` when referring to locations inside a building and recommends using `on the floor` instead.

harper.linters.OnSecondThought.description: Replaces the nonstandard `on second though` with the common idiom `on second thought` to indicate reconsideration.

harper.linters.OnTheSpurOfTheMoment.description: Ensures the correct use of `on the spur of the moment`, avoiding nonstandard variations.

harper.linters.OnceInAWhile.description: Corrects two common malapropisms of `once in a while`.

harper.linters.OnceOrTwice.description: Detects the mistaken phrase `once a twice` and suggests `once or twice`.

harper.linters.OneAndTheSame.description: This linter flags instances of the nonstandard phrase `one in the same`. The correct, more accepted form is `one and the same`

harper.linters.OneHanded.description: Treat 'one handed' and 'two handed' as single adjectives before nouns so the measurement stays attached to 'handed'.

harper.linters.OneOfTheSingular.description: Corrects 'one of the [singular]' to 'one of the [plural]'

harper.linters.OpenCompounds.description: Corrects compound words that should be written as two words.

harper.linters.OpenTheLight.description: Corrects using `open` instead of `turn on` or `switch on`

harper.linters.OperatingSystem.description: Ensures `operating system` is used correctly instead of `operative system`.

harper.linters.OrthographicConsistency.description: Ensures word casing matches the dictionary's canonical orthography.

harper.linters.OughtToBe.description: Detects the mistaken `out to be` and suggests `ought to be`, while ignoring legitimate phrasal-verb uses such as `turn out to be` and `make it out to be`.

harper.linters.OutOfDate.description: Ensures that the phrase `out of date` is written with a hyphen as `out-of-date` when used as a compound adjective.

harper.linters.Overall.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overall`.

harper.linters.Overclocking.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overclocking`.

harper.linters.Overload.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overload`.

harper.linters.Overnight.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `overnight`.

harper.linters.OxfordComma.description: The Oxford comma is one of the more controversial rules in common use today. Enabling this lint checks that there is a comma before `and`, `or`, or `nor` when listing out more than two ideas.

harper.linters.Oxymorons.description: Flags oxymoronic phrases (e.g. `amateur expert`, `increasingly less`, etc.).

harper.linters.PartsOfSpeech.description: Corrects pluralizing the wrong noun in `part of speech`.

harper.linters.PasswordProtectedHyphen.description: Keeps the compound adjective together before nouns like folders, files, or web pages so the dependency between them is clear.

harper.linters.PeaceOfMind.description: Corrects `piece of mind` to `peace of mind`.

harper.linters.PedalToTheMetal.description: Corrects the eggcorn `pedal to the medal` to the standard idiom `pedal to the metal`, meaning to accelerate at full speed.

harper.linters.PeekBehindTheCurtain.description: Corrects `peak behind the curtain` to `peek behind the curtain`.

harper.linters.PhrasalVerbAsCompoundNoun.description: This rule looks for phrasal verbs written as compound nouns.

harper.linters.Piggyback.description: Corrects the eggcorn `piggy bag` to `piggyback`, which is the proper term for riding on someone’s back or using an existing system.

harper.linters.PiqueInterest.description: Detects incorrect usage of `peak` or `peek` when the intended word is `pique`, as in the phrase `you've peaked my interest`.

harper.linters.PluralWrongWordOfPhrase.description: Corrects noun phrases that pluralize the last noun instead of the main noun.

harper.linters.PocketCastsNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Pocket Casts and Pocket Casts Plus as brand names.

harper.linters.PointsOfView.description: Corrects pluralizing the wrong noun in `point of view`.

harper.linters.PortAuPrince.description: Checks for the correct official name of the capital of Haiti.

harper.linters.PortoNovo.description: Checks for the correct official name of the capital of Benin.

harper.linters.PossessiveNoun.description: Use an apostrophe and `s` to form a noun’s possessive.

harper.linters.PossessiveYour.description: The possessive form of `you` is more likely before nouns.

harper.linters.Postpone.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `postpone`.

harper.linters.PrayingMantis.description: Corrects `preying mantis` to `praying mantis`, ensuring accurate reference to the insect’s characteristic pose.

harper.linters.ProgressiveNeedsBe.description: Detects the ungrammatical patterns `<pronoun> have …ing` (e.g., `I have …ing`) and `<pronoun>'ve …ing` (e.g., `I've …ing`) and suggests either the present progressive (e.g., `I'm/We're/You're/They're …`) or the present perfect progressive (e.g., `I/We/You/They have been …` or `I've/We've/You've/They've been …`).

harper.linters.PronounAre.description: Spots the letter `r` used in place of `are` or `you're` after plural first- or second-person pronouns.

harper.linters.PronounContraction.description: Choosing when to contract pronouns is a challenging art. This rule looks for faults.

harper.linters.PronounInflectionBe.description: Checks subject–verb agreement for the verb `be`. Third-person singular pronouns (`he`, `she`, `it`) require the singular form `is`, while the plural pronoun `they` takes `are`. The linter flags mismatches such as `He are` or `They is` and offers the correct concord.

harper.linters.PronounKnew.description: Detects when “new” following a pronoun (optionally with an adverb) is a typo for the past tense “knew.”

harper.linters.PronounVerbAgreement.description: Ensures pronouns agree with their verbs.

harper.linters.Proofread.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `proofread`.

harper.linters.ProperNouns.description: Ensure proper capitalization of proper nouns.

harper.linters.QuantifierNeedsOf.description: Detects missing `of` after the quantifier “a couple” when it precedes a plural noun

harper.linters.QuiteMany.description: Corrects `quite many` to `quite a few`, which is the more natural and idiomatic phrase in standard English. `Quite many` is considered nonstandard usage.

harper.linters.QuoteSpacing.description: Checks that quotation marks are preceded or succeeded by whitespace.

harper.linters.RainbowColoredHyphen.description: When rainbow-colored or cream-colored describe a noun, replace the space between the color words with a hyphen to keep the modifier cohesive.

harper.linters.RallyToReally.description: Catches the typo where `rally` sneaks into `be + ...ing` constructions, including common contractions.

harper.linters.RealTrouper.description: Ensures the correct use of `real trouper`, distinguishing it from `trooper`, which refers to a soldier or police officer.

harper.linters.RedundantAcronyms.description: Identifies redundant acronyms where the last word repeats the last letter's meaning (e.g., `ATM machine` → `ATM` or `automated teller machine`).

harper.linters.RedundantIIRC.description: Flags redundant use of 'if' or 'correctly' with `IIRC`, since `IIRC` already stands for 'if I recall correctly'.

harper.linters.RedundantPretty.description: `Pretty` is redundant when modifying `decent`. Use `decent` alone.

harper.linters.RedundantSuperlatives.description: Simplifies redundant double positives like `most optimal` to the base form.

harper.linters.RedundantThat.description: There is rarely a situation where `that that` cannot be condensed into a single token.

harper.linters.Regardless.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `regardless`.

harper.linters.RepeatedWords.description: This rule looks for repetitions of words that are not homographs.

harper.linters.Respond.description: Flags uses of the noun `response` where the verb `respond` is needed after an auxiliary.

harper.linters.RifeWith.description: Corrects `ripe with` to `rife with`, preserving the phrase’s meaning of being filled with something, often undesirable.

harper.linters.RiseTheQuestion.description: Corrects `rise the question` to `raise the question`.

harper.linters.RoadMap.description: Detects when `roadmap` is used instead of `road map`, prompting the correct spacing.

harper.linters.RollerSkated.description: Encourages hyphenating the past tense of `roller-skate`.

harper.linters.RulesOfThumb.description: Corrects pluralizing the wrong noun in `rule of thumb`.

harper.linters.SafeToSave.description: Detects `safe` (adjective) when `save` (verb) is intended after modal verbs like `could` or `should`.

harper.linters.SameAs.description: Corrects the incorrect phrase `same then` to the standard `same as`.

harper.linters.SaveToSafe.description: Corrects `save to <verb>` to `safe to <verb>` after a form of `be`.

harper.linters.ScantilyClad.description: Fixes `scandally clad` to `scantily clad`, ensuring clarity in describing minimal attire.

harper.linters.ScapeGoat.description: Corrects `scape goat` to `scapegoat`, which is the proper term for a person blamed for others' failures.

harper.linters.SemicolonApostrophe.description: Corrects semicolons accidentally typed instead of apostrophes.

harper.linters.SendAnEmailTo.description: Replaces the verbose phrase `send an email to` with the concise verb `email`.

harper.linters.SentenceCapitalization.description: The opening word of a sentence should almost always be capitalized.

harper.linters.ShootOneselfInTheFoot.description: Corrects nonstandard variants of 'shoot oneself in the foot'.

harper.linters.ShutdownVerb.description: Keeps `shutdown` as a noun when it stands alone but swaps it for the phrasal verb `shut down` whenever an auxiliary precedes it.

harper.linters.SimilarLike.description: The adjective 'similar' pairs with the preposition 'to', so never follow it with 'like'.

harper.linters.SimpleGrammatical.description: Corrects `simply grammatical` to `simple grammatical` for proper adjective usage.

harper.linters.SimplePastToPastParticipl.description: Corrects simple past tense verbs to past participle after auxiliary verbs like "have" or "be".

harper.linters.SinceDuration.description: Detects the use of 'since' with a duration instead of a point in time.

harper.linters.SingleBe.description: Removes adjacent duplicate inflections of `be`, including contracted forms followed by another `be` verb.

harper.linters.SomeOfThe.description: Quantity words such as `some` normally take `of` before a definite article. Including `of` signals that you mean a subset of a larger set, preventing a momentary stumble in comprehension.

harper.linters.SomeWithoutArticle.description: Detects the redundant article in front of `some` and suggests more natural phrasing.

harper.linters.Somebody.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `somebody`.

harper.linters.SomebodyElses.description: Corrects `somebody else's` when the `'s` is in the wrong place.

harper.linters.Somehow.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `somehow`.

harper.linters.Someone.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `someone`.

harper.linters.SomethingIs.description: Flags forms like `somethings` before progressive verbs and suggests using `something's` or `something is`.

harper.linters.SomewhatSomething.description: Flags the phrase `somewhat of a` in favor of `something of a`, which can be considered more traditional.

harper.linters.Somewhere.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `somewhere`.

harper.linters.SoonToBe.description: Hyphenates `soon-to-be` when it appears before a noun.

harper.linters.SoonerOrLater.description: Fixes the improper phrase `sooner than later` by suggesting standard alternatives.

harper.linters.Spaces.description: Words should be separated by at most one space.

harper.linters.SpellCheck.description: Looks and provides corrections for misspelled words.

harper.linters.SpelledNumbers.description: Most style guides recommend that you spell out numbers less than ten.

harper.linters.SpinalChord.description: The words `spinal`, `vocal`, `umbilical`, and `electrical` are followed by `cord`, so replace accidental `chord`/`chords`.

harper.linters.SplitWords.description: Finds missing spaces in improper compound words.

harper.linters.Starving.description: Encourages vivid writing by suggesting `starving` instead of weaker expressions like `very hungry.`

harper.linters.StateOfTheArt.description: Detects incorrect usage of `state of art` and suggests `state of the art` as the correct phrase.

harper.linters.StatuteOfLimitations.description: Corrects `statue of limitations` to `statute of limitations`.

harper.linters.StrikeChord.description: The phrase about resonating with someone is spelled with a chord, not a cord, so fix the typo and keep the idiom intact.

harper.linters.SubjectPronoun.description: Fixes sentences that start with `me and X` by putting the proper noun first and using `I`.

harper.linters.SufficeItToSay.description: Corrects `suffice to say` to `suffice it to say`.

harper.linters.SupposedTo.description: Fixes `suppose to` to the correct `supposed to`.

harper.linters.TakeALookTo.description: Corrects `take a look to`/`have a look to` to correctly use `at`.

harper.linters.TakeItPersonally.description: Corrects `take it personal` to `take it personally`.

harper.linters.TakeMedicine.description: Encourages pairing medicine-related nouns with verbs like `take` or `swallow` instead of `eat`.

harper.linters.ThanksALot.description: Corrects the missing article in `thanks lot`, forming `thanks a lot`.

harper.linters.ThatChallenged.description: Corrects `the challenged` to `that challenged` for proper relative clause usage.

harper.linters.ThatThan.description: Corrects the typo `that` to `than` in comparisons.

harper.linters.ThatThis.description: Fixes `the this` to the correct phrase `that this`.

harper.linters.ThatWhich.description: Repeating the word "that" is often redundant. The phrase `that which` is easier to read.

harper.linters.The.description: Fixes especially common misspellings of the word `the`

harper.linters.TheHowWhy.description: Removes the extra `the` from expressions like `the how`, skipping `how to` and `who's who`.

harper.linters.TheMy.description: Flags the definite article used together with a possessive.

harper.linters.TheProperNounPossessive.description: Checks for redundant `the` before possessive proper noun such as `The London's population`.

harper.linters.TheirToThere.description: Corrects `their` when the intended meaning is `there`.

harper.linters.TheirToTheyre.description: Corrects `their` when the intended meaning is `they're`.

harper.linters.ThereToTheir.description: Corrects `there` when the intended meaning is `their`.

harper.linters.Therefore.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `therefore`.

harper.linters.Theres.description: Replaces the mistaken possessive `their's` before a determiner with the contraction `there's`.

harper.linters.Thereupon.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `thereupon`.

harper.linters.ThesesThese.description: Corrects the common misspelling of `these` as `theses`.

harper.linters.TheyToThem.description: Converts `they` to `them` whenever the pronoun serves as an object after common prepositions or actions that take direct objects.

harper.linters.TheyreToTheir.description: Corrects `they're` when the intended meaning is `their`.

harper.linters.ThingThink.description: Corrects the typo `thing` when it should be `think`.

harper.linters.ThisTypeOfThing.description: Checks that the parts of `this/these type(s) of thing(s)` agree in grammatical number

harper.linters.ThoughThought.description: Corrects `though` when it's a typo for `thought`.

harper.linters.ThreatenVerb.description: Normalize `threat` to `threaten` when it is used after modals (or their contractions) because the noun form is being mistaken for a verb.

harper.linters.ThrowAway.description: Finds the typo `through away` and suggests `throw away` or `threw away` instead.

harper.linters.ThrowRubbish.description: Checks for throwing rubbish rather than throwing it away.

harper.linters.TickingTimeClock.description: Corrects `ticking time clock` to `ticking time bomb` for idiomatic urgency or `ticking clock` otherwise.

harper.linters.ToAdverb.description: Flags duplicated `to` around certain adverbs (e.g. `to never to`) and offers fixes that keep only one `to`.

harper.linters.ToBackOut.description: Treats `to backout` as a mistyped infinitive and prefers the two-word verb.

harper.linters.ToGreatLengths.description: Corrects `through great lengths` to `to great lengths`.

harper.linters.ToLoseTooLoose.description: Corrects mixing up `to` with `too` and `lose` with `loose`.

harper.linters.ToTheMannerBorn.description: Corrects `to the manor born` to `to the manner born`, ensuring the intended meaning of being naturally suited to a way of life.

harper.linters.ToWorryAbout.description: Fixes incorrect use of `to worried about`.

harper.linters.TongueInCheek.description: Corrects the idiom when `and` replaces the needed preposition.

harper.linters.Touristic.description: Suggests replacing the uncommon word `touristic` with `tourist`, `tourism`, and/or `touristy`.

harper.linters.TransposedSpace.description: Looks for a space one character too early or too late between words.

harper.linters.TrueToWord.description: Normalizes phrasing around `true to <possessive>` so it follows the conventional `true to one's word`.

harper.linters.TryOnesHandAt.description: Corrects `try one's hands at` to `try one's hand at`.

harper.linters.TuffEnough.description: The adjective `tough` pairs with words like `enough` or `like`, so correct the common typo `tuff` in those constructions.

harper.linters.TumblrNames.description: Ensure proper capitalization of Tumblr-related terms.

harper.linters.TurnItOff.description: Fixes the mistake in the phrase `turn it off`.

harper.linters.USUniversities.description: Ensure proper capitalization of major universities in the United States.

harper.linters.UnclosedQuotes.description: Quotation marks should always be closed. Unpaired quotation marks are a hallmark of sloppy work.

harper.linters.Underclock.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `underclock`.

harper.linters.UnitedOrganizations.description: When referring to national or international organizations, make sure to treat them as a proper noun.

harper.linters.UpdatePlaceNames.description: This rule looks for deprecated place names and offers to update them.

harper.linters.Upset.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `upset`.

harper.linters.Upward.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `upward`.

harper.linters.UseTitleCase.description: Prompts you to use title case in relevant headings.

harper.linters.VerbToAdjective.description: Looks for situations where a verb was written where an adjective is often intended.

harper.linters.VeryKnown.description: `very well-known` (or `well-known`) is the standard way to describe something widely recognized, so we flag the uncommon `very known` word pair.

harper.linters.VeryUnique.description: Flags phrases like `very unique`, `pretty unique`, etc., and suggests using `unique` alone or a more precise adjective such as `special`, `rare`, or `unusual`.

harper.linters.ViciousCircle.description: Corrects and standardizes common errors and variants of `vicious/virtuous circle`.

harper.linters.ViciousCycle.description: Corrects and standardizes common errors and variants of `vicious/virtuous cycle`.

harper.linters.WantBe.description: Detects incorrect usage of `want be` and suggests `won't be` or `want to be` based on context.

harper.linters.WasAloud.description: Ensures `was aloud` and `were aloud` are corrected to `was allowed` or `were allowed` when referring to permission.

harper.linters.WaveFunction.description: Identifies the mistake of merging `wave` and `function` into one word. In quantum mechanics, a `wave function` (written as two words) describes the mathematical function that represents the quantum state of a particle or system. Correct usage is crucial for clear and accurate scientific communication.

harper.linters.WayTooAdjective.description: Replaces the preposition `to` with the adverb `too` after `way` when followed by an adjective (e.g. `way too fast`)

harper.linters.WellKept.description: Flags `highly-kept` and recommends `well-kept` as an alternative.

harper.linters.Whereas.description: The Whereas rule is designed to identify instances where the phrase `where as` is used in text and suggests replacing it with the single word `whereas`.

harper.linters.Whereupon.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `whereupon`.

harper.linters.WhetYourAppetite.description: Ensures `whet your appetite` is used correctly, distinguishing it from the incorrect `wet` variation.

harper.linters.WholeEntire.description: Corrects the redundancy in `whole entire` to `whole` or `entire`.

harper.linters.WhomSubjectOfVerb.description: Detects whom and its variants used as the subject of a verb instead of who.

harper.linters.WidelyAccepted.description: Flags `wide accepted`, `wide acceptable`, or `wide used` and recommends switching `wide` to the adverb `widely`.

harper.linters.Widespread.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `widespread`.

harper.linters.WillContain.description: Incorrect verb form: `will` should be followed by the base form `contain`.

harper.linters.WinPrize.description: Catches the mix-up between `price`/`prise` and `prize` after the verb `win`.

harper.linters.WishCould.description: Checks for `can` being used after `wish` when it should be `could`.

harper.linters.WithoutOut.description: When writers accidentally type `without out`, Harper can collapse the two words back into the single preposition.

harper.linters.WordPressDotcom.description: Ensures correct capitalization of WordPress.com. This rule verifies that the official stylization of WordPress.com is used when referring to the hosting provider.

harper.linters.Worldwide.description: Looks for incorrect spacing inside the closed compound `worldwide`.

harper.linters.WorseOrWorst.description: Corrects `worse` and `worst` used in contexts where the other belongs.

harper.linters.WorstCaseScenario.description: Corrects `worst-case scenario` when the hyphen is missing or `worse` is used instead of `worst`.

harper.linters.WorthToDo.description: Corrects `worth to` + a verb to `worth` + the gerund of the verb.

harper.linters.WouldNeverHave.description: Corrects `would/could have never` to `never would/could have`.

harper.linters.WreakHavoc.description: Corrects the eggcorn `wreck havoc` to `wreak havoc`, which is the proper term for causing chaos or destruction.

harper.linters.WroughtIron.description: `Wrought iron` is low-carbon, malleable iron used for decorative work; variants like `rod iron` or `rot iron` are phonetic misspellings that may confuse readers.

harper.linters.YourPredicateAdjective.description: Catches cases where a predicate adjective follows `your`, `yr`, `ur`, or `ya` and suggests the proper contraction so the sentence states how someone is feeling or behaving.
